Package com.gnmathur.saarekaam.core.scheduler

Class SKTaskScheduler

java.lang.Object
com.gnmathur.saarekaam.core.scheduler.SKTaskScheduler
All Implemented Interfaces:
SKTaskSchedulerMBean
Direct Known Subclasses:
SKTaskSchedulerCron, SKTaskSchedulerFixedNumber, SKTaskSchedulerFixedRate
public abstract class SKTaskScheduler extends Object implements SKTaskSchedulerMBean

This abstract class is the base class for all task schedulers. It provides the basic functionality for scheduling tasks. The actual scheduling is done by the concrete implementations of this class. Different Task schedulers can be used for different types of tasks. Task schedulers are registered with the dispatcher SKManager at startup. The scheduler uses ScheduledExecutorService to schedule tasks. The actual task implementation creates an underlying thread. That thread lifecycles is managed by a second executor Executors, that uses a cached thread pool. This approach of wrapping the task in two layers makes it possible to cancel the (inner) task if it is taking too long to complete. The scheduler uses a LinkedHashMap to keep track of the running jobs. The scheduler will not schedule a job if it is already running. This prevents the scheduler from scheduling the same job multiple times. The implementation chose the Cached Thread Pool over the Fixed Thread Pool because the cached thread pool is suitable for short-lived asynchronous tasks, which is what would typically need for tasks. Since the Cached Thread Pool expires threads after 60s of inactivity, the implementation will result in threads being created and destroyed, though its expected to be minimal.

Author:
Gaurav Mathur
See Also:
  • SKManager
  • Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(int, ThreadFactory)
  • Executors.newCachedThreadPool(ThreadFactory)

    • shutdown

      public abstract void shutdown()
